## RedeemableERC20 class

A class for calling methods on a RedeemableERC20.

This is the ERC20 token that is minted and distributed.

During `Phase.ZERO` the token can be traded and so compatible with the Balancer pool mechanics. During `Phase.ONE` the token is frozen and no longer able to be traded on any AMM or transferred directly.

The token can be redeemed during `Phase.ONE` which burns the token in exchange for pro-rata erc20 tokens held by the `RedeemableERC20` contract itself.

The token balances can be used indirectly for other claims, promotions and events as a proof of participation in the original distribution by token holders.

The token can optionally be restricted by the `ITier` contract to only allow receipients with a specified membership status.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class RedeemableERC20 extends FactoryContract 
```
<b>Extends:</b> [FactoryContract](./rain-sdk.factorycontract.md)

## Remarks

This class provides an easy way to interact with RedeemableERC20's.

## Example


```typescript
import { RedeemableERC20 } from 'rain-sdk';

// To get a instance of an already deployed redeemable, pass the contract address and an ethers.js Signer
const redeemable = new RedeemableERC20(address, signer);

// Check if an address is child from the factory deployed in the current chain.
await RedeemableERC20.isChild(signer, maybeChildAddress);
```

Every other phase will map to a block number in <code>phaseBlocks</code>. |

Emits a <code>Transfer</code> event with <code>to</code> set to the zero address.<!-- -->Requirements: - Caller MUST have at least <code>amount</code> tokens. |

Simply wraps <code>phaseAtBlockNumber</code> for current values of <code>phaseBlocks</code> and <code>block.number</code>. |

|  [endDistribution](./rain-sdk.redeemableerc20.enddistribution.md) |  | (distributor: string, overrides?: [TxOverrides](./rain-sdk.txoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;ContractTransaction&gt; | The admin can forward or burn all tokens of a single address to end <code>PHASE_DISTRIBUTING</code>.<!-- -->The intent is that during <code>PHASE_DISTRIBUTING</code> there is some contract responsible for distributing the tokens.<!-- -->The admin specifies the distributor to end <code>PHASE_DISTRIBUTING</code> and the forwarding address set during initialization is used. If the forwarding address is <code>0</code> the rTKN will be burned, otherwise the entire balance of the distributor is forwarded to the nominated address. In practical terms the forwarding allows for escrow depositors to receive a prorata claim on unsold rTKN if they forward it to themselves, otherwise raise participants will receive a greater share of the final escrowed tokens due to the burn reducing the total supply.<!-- -->The distributor is NOT set during the constructor because it may not exist at that point. For example, Balancer needs the paired erc20 tokens to exist before the trading pool can be built. |
|  [grantReceiver](./rain-sdk.redeemableerc20.grantreceiver.md) |  | (newReceiver: string, overrides?: [TxOverrides](./rain-sdk.txoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;ContractTransaction&gt; | Admin can grant an address receiver rights.<!-- -->Requirements: - Caller have to be the admin |

|  [phaseAtBlockNumber](./rain-sdk.redeemableerc20.phaseatblocknumber.md) |  | (phaseBlocks: BigNumberish\[\], blockNumber: BigNumberish, overrides?: [ReadTxOverrides](./rain-sdk.readtxoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;BigNumber&gt; | Pure function to reduce an array of phase blocks and block number to a specific <code>Phase</code>.<!-- -->The phase will be the highest attained even if several phases have the same block number.<!-- -->If every phase block is after the block number then <code>0</code> is returned.<!-- -->If every phase block is before the block number then <code>MAX_PHASE</code> is returned. |
|  [phaseBlocks](./rain-sdk.redeemableerc20.phaseblocks.md) |  | (index: BigNumberish, overrides?: [ReadTxOverrides](./rain-sdk.readtxoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;number&gt; | Get a phaseBlock |
|  [redeem](./rain-sdk.redeemableerc20.redeem.md) |  | (treasuryAssets: string\[\], redeemAmount: BigNumberish, overrides?: [TxOverrides](./rain-sdk.txoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;ContractTransaction&gt; | Burn tokens for a prorata share of the current treasury. The assets to be redeemed for must be specified as an array. This keeps the redeem functionality:<!-- -->- Gas efficient as we avoid tracking assets in storage - Decentralised as any user can deposit any asset to be redeemed - Error resistant as any individual asset reverting can be avoided by redeeming againt sans the problematic asset.<!-- -->It is also a super sharp edge if someone burns their tokens prematurely or with an incorrect asset list. Implementing contracts are strongly encouraged to implement additional safety rails to prevent high value mistakes.<!-- -->Only "vanilla" erc20 token balances are supported as treasury assets. I.e. if the balance is changing such as due to a rebasing token or other mechanism then the WRONG token amounts will be redeemed. The redemption calculation is very simple and naive in that it takes the current balance of this contract of the assets being claimed via redemption to calculate the "prorata" entitlement. If the contract's balance of the claimed token is changing between redemptions (other than due to the redemption itself) then each redemption will send incorrect amounts. |
|  [symbol](./rain-sdk.redeemableerc20.symbol.md) |  | (overrides?: [ReadTxOverrides](./rain-sdk.readtxoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;string&gt; | Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name. |
|  [tier](./rain-sdk.redeemableerc20.tier.md) |  | (overrides?: [ReadTxOverrides](./rain-sdk.readtxoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;string&gt; | Tier contract that produces the report that <code>minimumTier</code> is checked against. |
|  [totalSupply](./rain-sdk.redeemableerc20.totalsupply.md) |  | (overrides?: [ReadTxOverrides](./rain-sdk.readtxoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;BigNumber&gt; | Returns the amount of tokens in existence. |
|  [transfer](./rain-sdk.redeemableerc20.transfer.md) |  | (to: string, amount: BigNumberish, overrides?: [TxOverrides](./rain-sdk.txoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;ContractTransaction&gt; | Moves <code>amount</code> tokens from the caller's account to <code>to</code>.<!-- -->Requirements:<!-- -->- <code>to</code> cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least <code>amount</code>. |
|  [transferFrom](./rain-sdk.redeemableerc20.transferfrom.md) |  | (from: string, to: string, amount: BigNumberish, overrides?: [TxOverrides](./rain-sdk.txoverrides.md)<!-- -->) =&gt; Promise&lt;ContractTransaction&gt; | Moves <code>amount</code> tokens from <code>from</code> to <code>to</code> using the allowance mechanism. <code>amount</code> is then deducted from the caller's allowance.<!-- -->NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum <code>uint256</code>.<!-- -->Requirements:<!-- -->- <code>from</code> and <code>to</code> cannot be the zero address. - <code>from</code> must have a balance of at least <code>amount</code>. - the caller must have allowance for \`\`<!-- -->from<!-- -->\`\`<!-- -->'s tokens of at least <code>amount</code>. |
